div.p: We present the x-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS) investigation performed at the L-edges of Ce work was to elucidate the responsable mechanism of the change into the magnetic porperties of the system upon Fe substitution.

As shown in Fig. 1, and contrary to previous assignements, the mixed-valence hehavior of Ce, as determined from the Ce L,-edge XANES spectra is preserved upon Fe substitution. Therefore no development of a localized 4f magnetic moment takes place at Ce atoms, driven by the Fe-Co substitution. This result is confiied by the study performed at the k.3-edges by means of the XMCD technique. Indeed, as shown in Fig. 2, the XMCD signal at the Ce L,3-edges resembles the existence of configurational mixing in the ground state, as in the case of polarization averaged XAS spectra (see Fig. 1). Moreover, upon developing of a localized Ce 4f magnetic moment a change of sign of the XMCD signals should be observed, contrary to the our experimental results.

The comparison of the integrated XMCD recorded at different temperatures is reported in Fig. 2. For both Fe K-edge and Nd L2,g-edges the signal grows in a continuous way when cooling down through Ts, showing a rounded maximum at about Tm= 110 K. This behavior describes the continuous increase of the tilting angle et as the temperature decreases. This angular dependence of the XMCD signal can be used to investigate the mutual orientation of the Nd and Fe magnetic moments in the SRT phase. Indeed, a collinear arrangement between the Fe and Nd moments was derived from earlier magnetization and 57Fe Mtlssbauer spectroscopy [2]. while from a 57 Fe Massbatter experiment performed in a wider temperature range it was deduced that the tilting angle deviates substantially from collinearity [3], as found also in a recent neutron diffraction investigation [5]. Comparison of the temperature dependence of the integrated XMCD signals and the available data on pNd and et is illustrated in Fig. 2. A remarkable similarity between the behavior of the XMCD signal and that derived from M(lssbaaer data by assuming the non-collinearity of the Nd and Fe moments, is observed.
